title: Consolidate pattern check errors

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

body:
Given:

```
enum E {
    Foo(String, String, String),
}

fn main() {
    match E::Foo("".into(), "".into(), "".into()) {
        E::Foo(a, b, ref c) => {}
    }
}
```

the current pattern check emits one diagnostic per mismatched usage:

```
error[E0009]: cannot bind by-move and by-ref in the same pattern
 --> file.rs:7:16
  |
7 |         E::Foo(a, b, ref c) => {}
  |                ^     ----- both by-ref and by-move used
  |                |
  |                by-move pattern here

error[E0009]: cannot bind by-move and by-ref in the same pattern
 --> file.rs:7:19
  |
7 |         E::Foo(a, b, ref c) => {}
  |                   ^  ----- both by-ref and by-move used
  |                   |
  |                   by-move pattern here
```

Ideally, [the pattern check](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f8d34596ff74da91e0877212a9979cb9ca13eb7e/src/librustc_mir/hair/pattern/check_match.rs#L529) should collect all problematic patterns when possible to reduce how many diagnostics are emitted:

```
error[E0009]: cannot bind by-move and by-ref in the same pattern
 --> file.rs:7:16
  |
7 |         E::Foo(a, b, ref c) => {}
  |                ^  ^  ----- both by-ref and by-move used
  |                |  |
  |                |  by-move pattern here
  |                by-move pattern here
  |
help: use by-ref everywhere
  |
7 |         E::Foo(ref a, ref b, ref c) => {}
  |                ^^^    ^^^
```
